## Diagnostics

In this vignette, we will provide a matrix of benchmarks for the
solvers, penalties, and GLM families in **golem**.

First, we setup a function to plot the results from the fit.

```{r}
set.seed(1)

library(golem)
library(lattice)
library(latticeExtra)

plot_optim <- function(fit) {
  d <- fit@diagnostics
  
  p1 <- xyplot(primal + dual ~ time, data = d, type = "l", 
               ylab = "Objetive",
               xlab = "Time (Seconds)", 
               auto.key = list(space = "inside", lines = TRUE,
                               points = FALSE))
  p2 <- xyplot(infeasibility ~ time, data = d, type = "l", 
               xlab = "Time (Seconds)",
               ylab = "Infeasibility")
  print(p1)
  print(p2)
}
```

### Gaussian model

```{r, fig.cap = "Objective loss over time for the abalone data set (Gaussian response)."}
x <- as.matrix(abalone$x)
y <- abalone$y

fit <- golem(x, y, family = "gaussian", diagnostics = TRUE)
plot_optim(fit)
```

### Binomial model

```{r, fig.cap = "Objective loss over time for the heart data set (binomial response)."}
x <- as.matrix(heart$x)
y <- heart$y

fit <- golem(x, y, family = "binomial", diagnostics = TRUE)

plot_optim(fit)
```
